transcript.text: My name is Alex and I was one of the
hardware developers.
>> My name is Jackson Semons and I was also
one of the hardware developers on the
project.
>> I'm Chundan and I'm the developer for
this project.
>> Hi, I'm Ben CK and I'm a front-end
developer.
>> Hi, I'm Nick French. I'm a front-end
developer and we're a part of Leader, an
innovative way to make composting easy
and accessible to households or
businesses with little to no gardening
experience.
In Australia, nearly 7.6 6 million tons
of food is wasted per year. That amounts
to approximately 312 kilos per person on
average. 80% of this waste is sent to
landfill creating 3% of our total
emissions. That's equivalent to nearly
13 million tons of carbon dioxide
annually or as much as Australia's
highest emitting coal fired power
station. When organic waste is left to
decompose in landfill, it doesn't get
the properation it needs, producing
methane and carbon dioxide gases. If
more households composted, we would
drastically reduce the waste going to
landfill. But there's a catch. Typical
household composting takes months to
complete, often resulting in more food
waste being produced than can be
composted. Our client found that by
optimizing the carbon to nitrogen levels
of the input and using a closed in
vessel system, this total composting
cycle can be reduced to just 60 days.
This is where Lita comes in. An invesy
automated by IoT, producing a carefree,
highquality composting solution for
households. Lita creates a controlled
environment for the food processing
microorganisms to thrive in. It achieves
through the automated rotation of each
chamber, aviation of compost, and proper
heat insulation. By expanding on the
previous work of last year's students,
we've been able to take our client
vision even further. We've improved on
the existing Arduino Raspberry Pi IoT
solution with more sensors and controls,
allowing us to collect more data about
oxygen, carbon dioxide, methane,
temperature, and moisture levels of each
invers
also providing the system more
micromanagement control by the use of
air pumps and motorized paddles.
Information collected throughout the
composting life cycle is uploaded to the
cloud, allowing consumers to view
details about the process anywhere in
the world. This information is displayed
on the Lita mobile app, providing
real-time sensor readouts, graphs of
current and previous composting life
cycles, and system logs when compost is
mixed or airated, giving customers a
piece of mind that their composting
system is working, while also providing
some educational insight into what's
going on. The mobile application is
built using React Native, suitable for
Android or iOS, making easily accessible
to everyone, no matter what type of
device they use. With Fleet, we believe
we can provide households with a
carefree composting system without the
tedious maintenance or knowledge
required for typical home composting,
allowing Australia to start reducing his
overall household waste and get us on
track for a greener future.
